ref: 8280 puraḥstha ʻ standing before the eyes, present ʼ Mālatīm. [purás, stha -- ]

lang: Language of `Kharoṣṭhī Inscriptions discovered by Sir Aurel Stein in Chinese Turkestan' edited by A. M. Boyer, E. J. Rapson, and E. Senart
ref: NiDoc. puraṭha, puraṭhida ʻ in the presence of ʼ;
Pk. purattha -- ʻ being in front ʼ;
K. b(r)ō̃ṭh adv. ʻ in front ʼ;
Si. puraṭu, ˚atu adv. ʻ in front ʼ, peraṭu, ˚atu ʻ standing in front ʼ (or < purástāt); --
Pk. puratthima -- ʻ being in front ʼ;
K. brū̃ṭhyumu ʻ belonging to former or future time ʼ. -- For
